mdRecord.dcterms:title: Ancient Roman spatula (replica)
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Replica of an ancient Roman spatula from the first century A.D. Most likely a replica of instrument number 135 cataloged in the following source: Bliquez, L.J. (1994) Roman surgical instruments and other minor objects in the National Archaeological Museum of Naples. Manz, von Zabern. Donated to the University of Virginia by members of the 8th Evacuation Hospital Unit of the United States Army. [original]
Photographed by Claude Moore Health Sciences Library, Historical Collections and Services staff. [original]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Medicine, Greek and Roman
Medical instruments and apparatus
